Set your voxes current job
Clears the vox job, the vox must be in the configuration state without any items in it.
Adds an item to the vox from the player's inventory.  If unit count is 0 or less the entire stack is moved.
Job must be running to cancel.
Job must be in finished state to collect.
Start a job in the configuration state that has been fully configured.
Removed an item from your vox and places it in your inventory. If unit count is 0 or less the entire stack is moved.
Set the item template to create for a vox job. Only compatible with mak jobs
Set the end quality for a refine job.  This quality must be higher then the current quality of the substance but less then teh max quality allowed on the substance.
Set the custom name for the item produced from a make job.
Sets the recipe to craft, compatible with several vox jobs.
Sets the number of items to create for a make job

request.description: Gets all server host names / addresses for a server by name and ChannelID.
Request all servers running a specified channel by ChannelID
Get traits by shard.
Request all servers

Moves an item from one location to another

Request parameters:

* UnitCount - if negative this will move all matching items.
* MoveItemID - Specify to move a particular item
* StackHash - Specify to filter on stack hash to move a group of items

* To/From:
  * CharacterID
    * From: The ID of the character that wraps the item to be moved. If valid, this ID will be used instead of the Entity ID
    * To: The ID of the character the item should move into. If valid, this ID will be used instead of the Entity ID
  * EntityID
    * From: The ID of the entity that wraps the item to be moved. This will be used only if the CharacterID is invalid. Either the CharacterID or EntityID must be specified
    * To: The ID of the entity the item should move into.  This will be used only if the CharacterID is invalid. Either the CharacterID or EntityID must be specified, except when dropping an item on the ground and not combining it with items already on the ground.
  * Position
    * From: The position to compair against in the case of moving a stack of items from a container or inventory.
    * To: The position to set on the moved items in the case of moving to/within a container or inventory.
  * ContainerID
    * From: The vox or container item that contains the item(s) to move.
    *To: The vox or conatiner item to move the item(s) into.
  * GearSlotIDs 
    * From: Not used
    * To: The gear slots to move the item into.  If no slots are specified, a best fit location will be used. Prioritizing empty slots on the player.
  * Location 
    * From: The type of location the item(s) are in
    * To: The type of location to move the item(s) to
    * Possible Values: Container, Equipment, Ground, Inventory, Vox, Trash
    * Trash location can only be moved to, not supported in from request
  * VoxSlot
    * From: The slot in a vox to remove an item from
    * To: the Slot in a vox to place an item into
    * Possible Values: Invalid, PrimarySubstance, SecondarySubstance1, SecondarySubstance2, SecondarySubstance3, Alloy, WeaponBlade, WeaponHandle, NonRecipe
Make multiple move item calls in one request
Invite another entity to trade items with you.

Revoke the current item trade invite that exists for your player.
An invite cannot be revoted after it has been accepted.
Accept an invitiation to begin a trade session from another entity.
Reject an invite which has been sent to you.
Lock down the items in your half of the trade window.  Once both parties have locked down their items they can confirm the trade.  You must be in the ModifyingItems state to do this.
Unlock the items in the trade window.  If the other player has confirmed, this will unconfirm their trade as well.  You must be in the Locked state to do so.
Add one or more items to the trade session.  You must be in the ModifyingItems secure trade state to do so.
Remove one or more items from the trade session.  You must be in the ModifyingItems secure trade state to do so.
Confirm a trade, a trade will not go through unless both parties have confirmed.  This can only be done from the Locked state.
Cancel a trade confirm, this will return this player to the locked state.  This can only be done from the Confirmed state.
Abort a trade you're in the middle of.  You cannot abort while in the confirmed state

item.name: CODEGEN
item.description: Code Generation methods provide TypeScript generated code for use with the CU Api.

request.description: Generated TypeScript interfaces, types, and Web Api controllers for working with this Web Api.
Creates a new active Warband. If you are a member of an active Warband, this request will automatically remove you from that Warband and create a new one.

Creates a new Battlegroup. 

If you are a member of an existing Battlegroup, this will automatically remove you from that Battlegroup and create a new one.

If you are a member of an active Warband:
 - And ARE the leader will create a new Battlegroup and pull in your entire active Warband with you.
 - And are NOT the leader will automatically remove you from your Warband, creating a new Battlegroup and Warband for you.
Creates a new Order.

Invite another character to a group.

*groupID is optional for an active Warband invite. If not provided, then the invite will assume your current active Warband.

*targetID is not required if targetName is provided.

*targetName is not required if targetID is provided.
